content: The "Taxpayer Protection Act of 2016" includes provisions for amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to protect taxpayers from abusive tax collection practices and provide relief for taxpayers. The "Taxpayer Protection Act of 2016" includes provisions for excluding de minimis discharge of indebtedness from gross income, repealing suspension of statute of limitations during pending Taxpayer Assistance order, limiting levy on retirement savings, tolling limitation on levy recovery for disabled taxpayers, extending period to withdraw frivolous submission, and repealing partial payment requirement on offers-in-compromise. It also provides assistance for identity theft victims and low-income taxpayers, including taxpayer notification of suspected identity theft, single point of contact for victims, referrals to low-income taxpayer clinics, and EITC outreach. Additionally, it ensures taxpayer access to competent tax return preparers. The "Taxpayer Protection Act of 2016" includes regulations for tax return preparers, disclosure of tax information related to preparer misconduct, funding for low-income taxpayer clinics, and IRS taxpayer services appropriations. It also addresses protection from abusive tax collection practices by repealing rules on tax collection contracts. SEC. 101 of the Taxpayer Protection Act of 2016 repeals rules related to tax collection contracts, including sections 6306 and 6307. Conforming amendments are made to sections 6103(k), 7433A(a), 7809(a), and 7811. TITLE II provides relief for taxpayers with a de minimis exclusion from gross income for discharge of indebtedness of individuals. The Taxpayer Protection Act of 2016 repeals tax collection contract rules and makes conforming amendments to various sections. It also provides relief for taxpayers by excluding discharge of indebtedness from gross income for qualified individual indebtedness. The Taxpayer Protection Act of 2016 provides relief for taxpayers by excluding discharge of indebtedness from gross income for qualified individual indebtedness, subject to a dollar limitation. The Taxpayer Protection Act of 2016 excludes discharge of indebtedness from gross income for qualified individual indebtedness, subject to a dollar limitation. Joint returns allow separate application of the limitation to each spouse, with the option to treat any spouse's indebtedness as the other's. Coordination ensures precedence of individual indebtedness exclusion over insolvency exclusion unless elected otherwise. The Taxpayer Protection Act of 2016 excludes discharge of indebtedness from gross income for qualified individual indebtedness, subject to a dollar limitation. The amendments made by this section shall apply to discharges of indebtedness after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 202. REPEAL SUSPENSION OF STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS DURING PENDING APPLICATION FOR TAXPAYER ASSISTANCE ORDER. Amends Section 7811 by redesignating subsections and making a conforming amendment. Effective on the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 203. LIMITATION ON LEVY ON RETIREMENT SAVINGS. The new paragraph added to Section 6334(a) allows for protection of an individual's interest in a qualified retirement plan before or after reaching normal retirement age if a levy would cause economic hardship. The term 'qualified retirement plan' is defined for this purpose. The term 'qualified retirement plan' refers to an individual retirement account or a defined contribution plan meeting specific criteria. An exception is made for flagrant acts as determined by the Secretary. The amendment made by this section applies to levies issued after December 31, 2016, unless the taxpayer filed a fraudulent return or acted with intent to evade taxes. SEC. 204. TOLLING OF LIMITATION ON LEVY RECOVERY FOR DISABLED TAXPAYER. This section amends Section 6343(b) to suspend the 9-month period for levy recovery for financially disabled individuals. SEC. 205. EXTENSION OF PERIOD TO WITHDRAW FRIVOLOUS SUBMISSION. This section amends Section 6702(b)(3) to extend the period to withdraw frivolous submissions from 30 days to 60 days, effective for notices provided after December 31, 2016. SEC. 206. REPEAL OF PARTIAL PAYMENT REQUIREMENT ON OFFERS-IN-COMPROMISE. Section 7122 is amended to reorganize subsections and make conforming amendments related to user fees for offers-in-compromise. Section 7122 is amended to reorganize subsections and make conforming amendments related to user fees for offers-in-compromise. The amendments made by this section shall apply to offers submitted after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 301. TAXPAYER NOTIFICATION OF SUSPECTED IDENTITY THEFT. Amends Chapter 77 to require the Secretary to notify taxpayers of suspected identity theft and criminal charges related to unauthorized use of their identity. SEC. 302. SINGLE POINT OF CONTACT FOR IDENTITY THEFT VICTIMS. The Secretary of the Treasury must establish procedures within 180 days to provide a single point of contact for taxpayers affected by identity theft. This contact will track and resolve issues quickly. SEC. 303. REFERRALS TO LOW-INCOME TAXPAYER CLINICS PERMITTED. SEC. 303. Referrals to low-income taxpayer clinics permitted. Treasury employees can refer taxpayers to qualified low-income taxpayer clinics for advice and assistance. Effective for referrals made after the enactment of this Act. The Secretary shall notify taxpayers annually if they did not claim a credit in previous years but may be eligible based on available information. The notice will be sent in writing to the taxpayer's last known address. The amendment made by this section will take effect on January 1, 2017 and will be notified in writing to the taxpayer's last known address. SEC. 401. REGULATION OF TAX RETURN PREPARERS. Section 330(a) of title 31, United States Code, is amended to regulate the practice of representatives before the Department of the Treasury and tax return preparers. Additionally, Section 330(c) is amended to provide authority to sanction regulated tax return preparers. Section 330(c) of title 31, United States Code is amended to include tax return preparers under its regulations. The definition of a tax return preparer is clarified to encompass individuals preparing tax returns or documents related to tax filings. The term 'tax return preparer' is defined under section 7701(a)(36) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The term 'tax return' is defined under section 6696(e)(1) of the same Code, and 'claim for refund' is defined under section 6696(e)(2). These definitions apply to returns and claims for refund for taxable years starting after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 402 amends Section 6103(k) to allow the Secretary to disclose tax return preparer misconduct decisions. SEC. 501 increases authorized grants for low-income taxpayer clinics to $20,000,000 and amends the section to include "qualified" before "low-income." The amendments apply to grants made after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 502 appropriates $2,406,000,000 for IRS taxpayer services for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017.
